wikipedia_page.main: Graham René Paul (born 15 May 1947) is a retired British international fencer.

link_mentions.page: St Neots
response: Footballers Lee Philpott and Tim Breacker are from the town, as well as Olympic High Jump Bronze medallist Robbie Grabarz and Olympic fencer Graham Paul. Multiple World short course swimming champion Mark Foster also lives in St Neots. Rob Harris, the guitarist of the popular musical group Jamiroquai, is also from the town.

link_mentions.page: René Paul
response: He is part of a famous fencing and athletics family; wife Doreen (), sons Graham Paul and Barry Paul, brother Raymond Paul and nephew Steven Paul.

link_mentions.page: Raymond Paul
response: Paul was the son of a French fencing master, who settled in London. He was the brother of René Paul, ex-husband of June Foulds-Paul, uncle of Barry Paul and Graham Paul and father of Steven Paul.

link_mentions.page: Barry Paul
response: He is part of a famous fencing and athletics family; his parents were René Paul and June Foulds, his brother is Graham Paul, his uncle was Raymond Paul and his cousin is Steven Paul.

link_mentions.page: Yehuda Weisenstein
response: Yehuda Weisenstein (; born 11 March 1955), known also as Moshe Yehuda Weinstein, is an Israeli former fencer. He competed in the individual foil event at the 1972 Summer Olympics when he was 17 years old.Sports Illustrated: Hate Mail from Cheerleaders and Other Adventures from the Life of Rick Reilly He was ranked fourth in his pool in round one with two wins (defeating American John Nonna and British fencer Graham Paul) and three losses and advanced to round two, where he lost all five bouts and was eliminated.

link_mentions.page: Steven Paul (fencer)
response: Steven Paul's family heritage was as part of a famous fencing and athletics family, including father Raymond Paul, uncle René Paul, Mother June Paul (Foulds), cousins Graham Paul and Barry Paul, grandson of Leon Paul. In later life he became the Head Coach and Chairman of the Royal Tunbridge Wells Fencing Club.
